title: SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video - Hindustan Times
summary:
SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

SpaceX experienced a setback during its seventh test mission of the Starship rocket when contact was lost about eight minutes into the flight, leading to the destruction of the spacecraft. This test represented the first for the upgraded Starship this year.

  • The Starship lifted off from Boca Chica, Texas, on January 17, 2025, at 5:38 PM EST.
  • SpaceX lost contact eight minutes into the flight after the rocket separated from its Super Heavy booster.
  • CEO Elon Musk shared a video of the debris falling and remarked that 'entertainment is guaranteed.'
  • The mission involved testing 10 dummy satellites intended to be released in orbit.
  • This marked the first operational flight of the upgraded Starship.
"We did lose all communications with the ship - that is essentially telling us we had an anomaly with the upper stage." - Dan Huot, SpaceX Communications Manager

This test flight highlights the ongoing challenges SpaceX faces in achieving reliable space travel, as well as the ambitious goals set forth by Elon Musk for future missions.
newTitle: SpaceX Starship Destroyed in Latest Test Flight

title: Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit?

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

The American Depository Receipts (ADRs) of Infosys fell 6% overnight following their December quarter results. Despite an upward revision of revenue guidance, shares witnessed a decline.

  • Infosys revised its revenue growth guidance for FY25 from 3.75%–4.5% to 4.5%–5%.
  • EBIT margin guidance remains unchanged at 20% to 22%.
  • Infosys shares also fell 1.5% in the Indian market before earnings announcement.
  • Organic Services revenue decreased by 0.9% sequentially.
  • Revenue from Infosys' top five clients decreased by 6.4% sequentially in USD terms.
  • Attrition rate rose to 13.7%.
  • Infosys won $2.5 billion in deals for the quarter, but Total Contract Value is down 32% year-on-year.
“The management spoke of impending wage hikes that will impact margins in the upcoming quarter.”

Despite a recovery in deals won, the overall figures reflect declining performance, prompting concerns about future growth.
newTitle: Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit?

title: Reliance Retail Q3 Results: Net profit up 10% to ₹3,485 crore, revenue up 7% YoY led by festive season - Mint

Reliance Industries Ltd. has reported a net profit increase of 10% for the quarter ending December 2023, attributed to strong festive season sales and growth in its consumer brands.

  • Net profit reached ₹3,485 crore.
  • Revenue grew by 7% year-on-year.
  • Reliance's Campa and Independence brands are expected to cross ₹1,000 crore each in FY25.
  • RCPL's revenue for the first nine months of FY25 reached ₹8,000 crore.
  • Competitors are experiencing pressure from the pricing strategy of Campa Cola.
  • Reliance Retail opened 779 new stores, bringing the total to 19,102.

title: Axis Bank Q3 Results: Net Profit Rises 3.83% YoY To Rs 6,303.77 Crore; Check Details - News18
summary:
Axis Bank Q3 Results: Net Profit Rises 3.83% YoY To Rs 6,303.77 Crore; Check Details

Last Updated: January 16, 2025, 21:51 IST

Private sector lender Axis Bank reported a net profit of Rs 6,303.77 crore for the December 2024 quarter, reflecting a 3.83% increase compared to Rs 6,071.1 crore in the previous year.

  • The bank's gross non-performing assets ratio stood at 1.46% at the end of December, slightly up from 1.44% in the previous quarter.
  • Provisions and contingencies allocated for potential bad loans more than doubled year-on-year to 21.56 billion rupees.
  • Indian lenders are facing challenges with rising bad loans, particularly in sectors like microfinance.
The lender’s provisions and contingencies more than doubled year-on-year.

The performance indicates a modest growth trajectory amidst challenging conditions in the lending market.

summary:
Infosys ADRs plunge over 6% post Q3 earnings despite upward revenue guidance

Date: Recent

American Depository Receipts (ADRs) of Infosys fell by 6.3% despite the company's better-than-expected earnings and an upward revision of its revenue guidance.

  • Infosys reported a net profit of Rs 6,806 crore, up 11% Year-on-Year (YoY).
  • Revenue from operations increased by 8% YoY to Rs 41,764 crore.
  • The company raised its revenue guidance for the fiscal year to 4.5%-5%.

title: Stock exchanges ban fresh F&O positions in Kalyan Jewellers - Mint
summary:
Stock Exchanges Prohibit New F&O Positions in Kalyan Jewellers

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

India’s stock exchanges have banned fresh trading of Kalyan Jewellers Ltd’s stock futures and options contracts after trader positions approached regulatory limits, following a significant decline in the company's market capitalisation.

The ban comes after Kalyan Jewellers’ share price fell significantly, despite management attempts to mitigate investor concerns.

  • The company’s share price dropped 32% from a record high of ₹795.4 on January 2 to ₹539.
  • The traders had significant open interest in Kalyan Jewellers’ contracts, nearing 95% of the market-wide position limit.
  • Management assured investors that business operations remained normal despite the stock price decline.
  • Kalyan Jewellers has received mixed ratings from analysts, with five ‘buy’ recommendations.
“Management vehemently denied all rumors regarding impropriety during an analyst call.”

The F&O ban will remain until trading positions fall below the 80% marketwide limit. This situation is critical for investors as market sentiments fluctuate amid regulatory concerns.
newTitle: Stock Exchanges Prohibit New F&O Positions in Kalyan Jewellers

Date: January 16, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

American Depository Receipt (ADR) shares of India's second-largest software services provider, Infosys, observed a significant drop on the NYSE after announcing its quarterly results.

The company's net profit rose by 11.4% year-on-year, yet the ADR fell sharply despite improved revenue guidance.

  • Infosys ADR declined by 6% to $21.515.
  • Reported Q3FY25 net profit of ₹6,806 crore, up from ₹6,106 crore last year.
  • Quarterly revenue stood at ₹41,764 crore, a YoY increase of 7.6%.
  • Revenue growth guidance for FY25 increased to 4.5-5%.
“Despite a rise in profit and revenue guidance, the market reacted negatively.”

This decline raises concerns among investors regarding future performance even with optimistic growth predictions.

summary:
Reliance Industries Q3 result highlights

Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), a major conglomerate led by Mukesh Ambani, reported strong Q3 FY25 earnings across its diverse business segments.

title: Gold rallies nearly 1% after mixed Retail Sales adds to disinflationary tailwind fueling a Bullion rally - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Rallies Nearly 1% After Mixed Retail Sales Data Fuels Bullion Surge

Publication Date: N/A Source: FXStreet

Gold's price is experiencing a rally, currently above $2,715, primarily driven by the release of mixed Retail Sales and a disinflationary Consumer Price Index on Wednesday.

  • Gold price has broken above $2,715 and is approaching $2,721.
  • Expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut are rising, shooting up the demand for bullion.
  • Retail Sales for December missed expectations at 0.4%, revised from 0.7% to 0.8%.
"The odds of a rate cut by the Federal Reserve in June stand at 63.8%, indicating a significant shift in market expectations."

title: Reliance Jio Q3 Results: Net profit up 24.4% to ₹6,477 crore, revenue rises 15.5% to ₹29,307 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
Reliance Jio Q3 Results: Net profit up 24.4% to ₹6,477 crore, revenue rises 15.5% to ₹29,307 crore

Date: January 16, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Reliance Jio reported significant growth in its third quarter, with a net profit of ₹6,477 crore, a 24.4% increase compared to the previous year. Revenue also saw a rise of 15.5% to ₹29,307 crore.

  • Net profit at ₹6,477 crore, up 24.4% year-on-year.
  • Revenue reached ₹29,307 crore, a 15.5% increase year-on-year.
  • EBITDA stood at ₹15,478 crore, with an EBITDA margin of 52.8%.
  • Subscriber base grew to 482.1 million, with an average revenue per user (ARPU) increase to ₹203.3.
  • Transitioned 170 million users to True5G network, accounting for 40% of data traffic.
  • Consumption of 46.5 billion gigabytes of data in Q3.
Mukesh Ambani stated, "Robust growth in digital services was led by sustained subscriber addition and consistent improvement in customer engagement metrics."

The positive results indicate Jio's strong performance in a competitive telecom market, reinforcing its leadership in digital services.
newTitle: Reliance Jio Reports Strong Q3 Results with 24.4% Profit Increase

title: Reliance Jio Q3 Results: Net profit up 22% to ₹6,477 crore, revenue rises 14.4% to ₹29,307 crore - CNBCTV18
RIL Q3 results: Net profit rises 7.4% to Rs 18,540 cr, beats estimates - Business Standard
summary:
RIL Q3 results: Net profit rises 7.4% to Rs 18,540 cr, beats estimates

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Reliance Industries Ltd

Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) reported a 7.4% year-on-year increase in net profit, amounting to Rs 18,540 crore for the third quarter of FY25, surpassing analyst expectations.

  • Consolidated profit before interest, depreciation, and taxes (PBIDT) rose 7.8% YoY to Rs 48,003 crore.
  • Consolidated revenue recorded Rs 2.39 trillion, up 6.6% YoY, with contributions from oil-to-chemicals, retail, and telecom sectors.
  • Telecom revenue increased by 19.4%, highlighting strong growth in digital services.
  • RIL’s Chairman Mukesh Ambani emphasized the robust performance amidst ongoing volatility in global energy markets.
“Robust growth in digital services business was led by sustained subscriber addition and consistent improvement in customer engagement metrics.” - Mukesh Ambani

This positive quarterly performance marked a reversal from RIL's previous three quarters of declining profits.
newTitle: RIL Reports 7.4% Increase in Q3 Net Profit, Exceeds Analyst Estimates

title: Reliance Jio Q3 Results: PAT jumps 26% YoY to Rs 6,861 crore; ARPU at Rs 203.3 - The Economic Times
summary:
Reliance Jio Q3 Results: PAT jumps 26% YoY to Rs 6,861 crore; ARPU at Rs 203.3

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: Economic Times

Reliance Jio Infocomm reported a significant jump in its net profit for the December quarter, showcasing robust financial performance.

  • Consolidated net profit increased by 26% YoY, totaling Rs 6,861 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose to Rs 33,074 crore, a 19.4% increase from the previous year.
  • Average Revenue Per User (ARPU) was Rs 203.3, up 12% YoY.
  • Total subscriber base reached 482 million with a 2.4% increase YoY.
  • Jio is the world's leading standalone 5G operator outside China, with over 170 million subscribers.
  • EBITDA stood at Rs 16,585 crore, marking a 19% increase YoY.
  • EBITDA margin for Q3FY25 was 50.1%, a slight decline from the previous year.
"Jio will continue to lead the charge in technology innovation by fully embracing the power of AI to create a connected, intelligent future that is truly transformative." - Akash M Ambani

This impressive growth highlights Reliance Jio's ongoing success and its commitment to advancing technology and expanding its services in India.
newTitle: Reliance Jio Q3 Results Show Strong Growth with 26% PAT Increase

title: Havells Q3 Results | Net profit falls 3%; declares dividend, misses estimates - CNBCTV18
summary:
Havells Q3 Results | Net profit falls 3%; declares dividend, misses estimates

Date: January 16, 2024

Source: CNBC-TV18

Havells India Ltd reported a disappointing 3% drop in net profit for Q3, amidst increasing revenue but missing expected targets.

  • Net profit for Q3 fell to ₹278 crore, down from ₹287 crore YoY, against expectations of ₹344 crore.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 10.8% to ₹4,889 crore, but was below the predicted ₹4,991 crore.
  • EBITDA dipped 1.5% to ₹426.4 crore, missing the estimate of ₹494 crore.
  • The EBITDA margin decreased to 8.7% from 9.8% YoY.
  • The board declared an interim dividend of ₹4 per equity share, amounting to 400% on the equity share capital.
"The results came after the close of the market hours. Shares of Havells India Ltd ended at ₹1,557.30 up by ₹29.65, or 1.94%, on the BSE."

In conclusion, while Havells experienced revenue growth, the fall in profit margins and missed estimates raise concerns about future performance.
newTitle: Havells Q3 Results: Net Profit Falls 3% and Declares Dividend

title: BPCL inks ₹31,802 crore loan deal with SBI-led consortium for petrochemical, refinery projects - CNBCTV18
summary:
BPCL Secures ₹31,802 Crore Loan from SBI-Led Consortium for Expansion Projects

Publication Date: January 16, 2025Source: CNBC TV18

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL) has finalized a substantial loan agreement with an SBI-led consortium to finance the development of a petrochemical complex and expand its refinery in Bina, Madhya Pradesh.

  • The loan amount is ₹31,802 crore.
  • The consortium includes Punjab National Bank, Union Bank of India, Canara Bank, Bank of India, and Export-Import Bank of India.
  • The funding will aid in producing downstream polymers and chemicals.
  • Refinery capacity will increase from 7.8 MMTPA to 11 MMTPA.
  • This initiative is expected to enhance BPCL's production capabilities and meet India’s rising petrochemical demand.
“This strategic initiative is set to boost BPCL's production capabilities and support India's growing demand for petrochemical products.”

This loan agreement represents a significant step forward for BPCL, facilitating critical infrastructure developments to align with market demands.
newTitle: BPCL Secures ₹31,802 Crore Loan from SBI-Led Consortium for Expansion Projects

The Mahindra XUV7OO has been a massive hit since its launch in 2021. With a new focus on energy vehicles, Mahindra plans to release a more powerful version called the XEV 7e, an all-electric version of the XUV 7OO that has been recently spotted.

Kia India Launches New SUV Syros Ahead of Auto Expo

title: Landmark Immigration Consultants IPO: SME issue booked 1.8x on Day 1; check GMP & other details | Stock Market News - Mint
SME stock with 4,00,000 PE grabs Sebi attention, co restrained from accessing markets - The Economic Times
Sebi halts trading in this SME stock after PE touches unheard levels of 4,00,000 - The Economic Times
summary:
Sebi Intervenes in Pacheli Industrial Finance with Record PE Ratio of 400,000

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: Financial News

After Pacheli Industrial Finance's P/E ratio skyrocketed to 400,000, the regulator Sebi halted the company's access to capital markets due to concerns of a potential 'pump and dump' scheme.

The stock's value increased by 372% over a month, despite the company having negligible revenues over the previous three years.

  • Shares rose from Rs 21.02 in December 2023 to Rs 78.2 by January 16, 2024.
  • Company had no operating income for FY22 and FY23, and only Rs 1.07 crore in FY24.
  • Sebi's action followed concerns about the legitimacy of Rs 1,000 crore loans secured after a management change.
  • Trading in securities is prohibited for PIFL and associated entities until further notice.
Sebi's investigation revealed possible round-tripping of funds linked to the loans secured by the company.

The Sebi intervention highlights the need for regulatory oversight in capital markets, especially in cases of unusual price surges.
newTitle: Sebi Intervenes in Pacheli Industrial Finance with Record PE Ratio of 400,000
